article.headline: Georgia Southern 68, Furman 63
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. (AP) -- Senior forward Matt Fields sparked a late 12-0 run that carried Georgia Southern to a 68-63 win over Furman in the conference opener Friday. Trailing 53-50, the Eagles (4-1, 1-0 Southern Conference) opened the run on Louis Graham's free throw with 6:02 remaining. Fields followed with three straight baskets, including the go-ahead points at 55-53 on a baby hook shot at 4:38. Willie Powers' layup at the 2:05 mark ended the run at 61-53. Junior guard Julian Allen scored a game-high 17 points to pace Georgia Southern. Fields had 12, Graham added 11 and a game-high 13 rebounds. Freshman guard Bobby Austin scored 15 for the Paladins (0-4, 0-1), with Justin Dehm adding 12 and George Brozos 10. Allen scored seven of the Eagles first 14 points and Fields gave Georgia Southern its largest lead of the night at 24-13 on a short hook shot at the 8:45 mark in the first half. Furman used a 13-2 run to take its only lead of the second half at 53-50 on Brozos' 3-pointer with 6:19 remaining.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
